intro: Chuquiraga erinacea f. pulvinata, commonly known as the pulvinated chuquiraga, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, fluffy seed heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
